title: Motor Skill Acquisition Strategies Using a Constraint-Led Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Targeting office/administrative workers, emphasizing practical approaches to enhance physical activity efficiency during work.

learning_goals: Learners can improve three core technical elements of hurdling (foot planting, aerial posture, landing) with 80% accuracy by manipulating constraints
Learners can mathematically model the motor skill acquisition process by applying Constraints-Led Approach (CLA) principles and derive at least three personalized optimal constraint conditions
Learners can analyze technical performance videos using a peer assessment system and provide feedback aligned with expert evaluation criteria (ICC ≥ 0.75).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
